name: nytimes
text: Facing a dangerous spike in coronavirus cases on Capitol Hill, Congress’s attending physician urged U.S. lawmakers to improve their social-distancing and mask-wearing practices. https://t.co/P49rhIbZfH

name: nytimes
text: Rudy Giuliani, who has led the most extensive efforts to undermine the election results, discussed with President Trump the possibility of receiving a pre-emptive pardon before Trump leaves office. https://t.co/PfnQQwsokl

name: nytimes
text: For blind and visually impaired New Yorkers, the decrease in traffic noise because of the pandemic has made it more difficult to navigate city streets. Audible crosswalk signals help, but the vast majority of the city’s 13,200 crossings lack one. https://t.co/PtxbyjZv9t

name: nytimes
text: Rep. Mark Walker announced that he would run for North Carolina’s open Senate seat in 2022, kicking off what is likely to be a fierce Republican primary that could pit him against Lara Trump, the president’s daughter-in-law. https://t.co/tmf1IYbLC4

name: nytimes
text: A small but growing body of evidence suggests that some rapid tests for the coronavirus may falter in children, letting low-level infections slip by unnoticed. https://t.co/yTENnNCPyz

name: nytimes
text: The U.S. Soccer Federation and its World Cup champion women’s team said Tuesday that they have reached a deal over working conditions, a rare moment of mutual happiness in the sides’ long-running legal fight about equal pay. https://t.co/CeyXe16CRo

name: nytimes
text:
President-elect Joe Biden is entering office with the stated intent of restoring credibility to government — and to the White House briefing room. Here are the women on the communications team he announced this week who will lead that effort.
https://t.co/sz7NYlXUxQ

name: nytimes
text:
A former Arizona official was sentenced on Tuesday to more than six years in federal prison for running a multistate adoption fraud scheme that included arranging for women from the Marshall Islands to fly to the U.S. to give birth, prosecutors said.
https://t.co/oPLHyoxyAi

name: nytimes
text:
Gabriel Sterling, a Georgia elections official, condemned President Trump and other Republican leaders for not speaking out against the violent threats and harassment directed at election workers.
https://t.co/Qu9Qc7zV2y https://t.co/NkUsbpVkuQ

name: nytimes
text:
A professional sportsman — who, in 2012, performed during Madonna’s Super Bowl halftime show — on Tuesday took credit with his group for the sudden disappearance of the monolith that mysteriously appeared in the Utah desert.
https://t.co/u0O6XIAlNI

name: nytimes
text:
California has long had one of the nation’s lowest number of hospital beds relative to its population. Now officials say that shortfall may prove catastrophic as the state faces another coronavirus surge, with an average of nearly 15,000 new cases a day.
https://t.co/Sus9XQhXWR

name: nytimes
text:
The swift and bitter pushback to President-elect Joe Biden’s choice of Neera Tanden to lead his budget office underscored the difficulties the incoming administration will face in maneuvering its nominees through a polarized Senate.
https://t.co/lCey2z4pCT

name: nytimes
text:
California has long had few hospital beds relative to its population, a shortfall that officials now say may prove catastrophic as the state faces another coronavirus surge, with an average of nearly 15,000 new cases a day.
https://t.co/RW7MPv0czq

name: nytimes
text:
The Justice Department has been investigating whether intermediaries for a federal convict offered White House officials a bribe in exchange for a potential pardon or commutation from President Trump, according to court documents unsealed on Tuesday.
https://t.co/MQfe6yiP5X

name: nytimes
text:
The captain of a dive boat that caught fire last year off the coast of California, killing 34 people, was indicted on Tuesday. Investigators said that he had neglected key safety precautions that had contributed to the deadliness of the fire.
https://t.co/C0rmedCTEp

name: nytimes
text:
President-elect Joe Biden on Tuesday called on Congress to pass a pandemic relief package to help keep businesses and households afloat while his Treasury secretary nominee, Janet Yellen, called the damage done so far “an American tragedy.”
https://t.co/t1mpx1eEaY

name: nytimes
text:
In Opinion

"The right to exercise religion in accordance with conscience is one of the most important in the Bill of Rights, and it is time for mayors and governors — and courts — to treat it that way," write Michael W. McConnell and Max Raskin.
https://t.co/QqGAK58a5n

name: nytimes
text:
Cecilia Rouse, President-elect Joe Biden’s nominee to lead the Council of Economic Advisers, has studied education and discrimination, with a particular focus on the struggles of the long-term unemployed.
https://t.co/97D2y30uia

name: nytimes
text:
A top Georgia election official condemned President Trump and other Republican leaders for not speaking out against the violent threats directed at election workers. “It has to stop,” he said.
https://t.co/uFJe7Yrfg4

name: nytimes
text:
Invitations to at least 20 White House holiday parties have been sent out so far. Guests would be strongly encouraged to wear masks when they were not eating and the guest lists were smaller than usual, one official said.
https://t.co/duwtSo8Skj

name: nytimes
text:
Attorney General William Barr acknowledged on Tuesday that the Justice Department has uncovered no voting fraud “on a scale that could have effected a different outcome in the election,” a striking repudiation of President Trump’s false claims.
https://t.co/qWYWAZ7jkf
